usefulItems: baking tray and baking paper, rolling pin, pastry brush, oven
title: Pide with Lamb, Cinnamon, Pine Nuts and Yoghurt

ingredients.content: 500 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
20 g extra virgin olive oil, plus extra for brushing and greasing
500 g lamb mince, broken in pieces
½ bunch fresh coriander, leaves only

preparations.content: Preparation
Dough
Place flour, yeast, olive oil, water and salt in mixing bowl then knead <b>40 sec/<b>.
Transfer dough to a lightly-oiled bowl and leave to rise until doubled in size (at least 1 hour). Clean mixing bowl.
Tip dough out onto a work surface and shape into a large ball using lightly-floured hands.
Roll dough into a rectangle and divide into 8 equal pieces.
Shape each piece into a smooth ball using lightly-floured hands. Cover with a tea towel and set aside to rest while making filling.
Lamb Filling
Place onions and garlic in mixing bowl then chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>.
Add oil then cook <b>5 min/120°C/speed <b>. Remove lid and leave to cool for 5-10 minutes.
Add lamb, pine nuts, cinnamon, salt and pepper then mix <b>20 sec//speed <b>.
Assembly
Preheat oven to 200°C and line a large baking tray with baking paper.

With lightly-floured hands and working with one ball at a time, roll out to form a long oval. Roll across the middle to make it slightly wider without losing the oval shape (approx. 23 cm x 13 cm). Repeat with remaining balls of dough.
Place lamb filling down the centre of each oval of dough flattening it out a little, leaving 3-4 cm at each end.
Fold long edges in, leaving 4 cm uncovered in the centre.
Pinch each short end together and twist into a small ball to resemble a small boat.
Transfer pides to prepared baking tray. Moisten dough edges with water and scatter with sesame seeds. Leave to rest for 30 minutes.
Spoon 2 tsp yoghurt on top of each pide then bake 15-20 minutes (200°C) until puffed and golden.
Remove from oven, brush with extra virgin olive oil and sprinkle with sumac and coriander leaves before serving.

hintsAndTricks: When preparing the dough, at the end of <b>step 5<b> the balls of dough can be covered and refrigerated or frozen for later use.
Depending on the size of your oven you may need two trays with <b>4 pides<b> on each.
For a vegetarian option, replace the lamb mince with a similar weight of cooked spinach mixed with ricotta.
